BodyName: Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Health and the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to mandating that correction officers escort inmates to medical visits in a timely fashion.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Mandating that correction officers escort inmates to medical visits in a timely fashion.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to discharge planning for inmates in city correctional facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Discharge planning for inmates in city correctional facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to post on its website an annual report regarding mentally ill inmates and recidivism, and to repeal section 3 of local law number 54 for the year 2004, relating to the date such local law is repealed
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOC to post on its website an annual report regarding mentally ill inmates and recidivism, and to repeal section 3 of LL# 54 for the year 2004, relating to the date such local law is repealed.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to evaluate programs it utilizes
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOC to evaluate programs it utilizes.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the use of trauma-informed care in city correctional facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the use of trauma-informed care in city correctional facilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the federal government to continue Medicaid coverage for individuals while they are incarcerated in correctional facilities, including New York City jails.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Continue Medicaid coverage for individuals while they are incarcerated in correctional facilities, including NYC jails.

Items.Title: Oversight - Evaluating Recent Changes in Healthcare in City Correctional Facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Evaluating Recent Changes in Healthcare in City Correctional Facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring arrestee health screenings and the exchange of health information of inmates in the custody of the department of correction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Arrestee health screenings and the exchange of health information of inmates in the custody of the department of correction.
